變.definition: to change; to become different; to transform; to vary; rebellion

變作.definition: to change into; to turn into; to become

變價.definition: to appraise at the current rate

變動.definition: to change; to fluctuate; change; fluctuation

變化.definition: (intransitive) to change; to vary; change; variation (CL:個|个[ge4])

變化多端.definition: changeable; changing; varied; full of changes

變化球.definition: (baseball) breaking ball; (fig.) curveball; unexpected turn of events

變化音.definition: (music) accidental (a note foreign to the key signature)

變卦.definition: to change one's mind; to go back on one's word

變回.definition: to revert; to change back into

變天.definition: to have a change of weather (esp. for the worse); (fig.) to experience a major upheaval; to undergo sweeping change

變工.definition: to exchange labor; labor exchange (system of sharing workforce resources)

變幻莫測.definition: to change unpredictably; unpredictable; erratic; treacherous

變形.definition: to become deformed; to change shape; to morph

變徵之聲.definition: modified fifth note of the pentatonic scale

變心.definition: to cease to feel a sense of loyalty (or gratitude etc) to sb or sth; to fall out of love with sb

變性.definition: to denature; denaturation; to have a sex change; transsexual

變態.definition: to metamorphose (biology); abnormal; perverted; hentai; (slang) pervert

變成.definition: to change into; to turn into; to become

變戲法.definition: to perform conjuring tricks; to conjure; to juggle

變把戲.definition: to perform magic; to do magic tricks; prestidigitation

變換.definition: to transform; to convert; to vary; to alternate; a transformation

變文.definition: a popular form of narrative literature flourishing in the Tang Dynasty (618-907) with alternate prose and rhymed parts for recitation and singing (often on Buddhist themes)

變更.definition: to change; to alter; to modify

變本加厲.definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming); to aggravate; to intensify

變樣兒.definition: erhua variant of 變樣|变样[bian4 yang4]

變法.definition: to change the laws; political reform; unconventional method

變法兒.definition: to try by all available methods

變現.definition: to realize (an asset); to liquidate; to sell for cash; to monetize

變生肘腋.definition: lit. calamity in one's armpit (idiom); a major coup happening on one's doorstep; trouble or danger in one's own backyard

變異型克雅氏症.pinyin: biàn yì xíng kè yǎ shì zhèng

變磚.definition: (of an electronic device) to brick; to become inoperable

變種.definition: (biology) a mutation; a variety; a variant; a variety

變節.definition: betrayal; defection; turncoat; to change sides politically

變老.definition: to grow old; to age; aging

變聲.definition: voice change (at puberty); to alter one's voice (deliberately); to sound different (when angry etc)

變臉.definition: to turn hostile suddenly; face changing, a device of Sichuan Opera, a dramatic change of attitude expressing fright, anger etc

變色.definition: to change color; to discolor; to change countenance; to become angry

變色易容.definition: to change color and alter one's expression (idiom); to go white with fear; out of one's wits

變裝.definition: to change clothes; to dress up; to put on a costume; to cosplay; to cross-dress

變調.definition: tone sandhi; modified tone; (music) to change key; modulation

變質.definition: to degenerate; to deteriorate; (of food) to go bad; to go off; (geology) metamorphism

變身.definition: to undergo a transformation; to morph; to turn into; transformed version of sb or sth; new incarnation

變通.definition: pragmatic; flexible; to act differently in different situations; to accommodate to circumstances

變速.definition: to change speed; to shift gear; variable-speed

變造.definition: to alter; to modify; to mutilate (of documents)

變音記號.definition: (music) accidental (symbol such as a sharp (♯), flat (♭), natural (♮) etc)
